intro: Indigofera exigua, commonly known as small indigo or dwarf indigo, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. It has a short growth habit, typically reaching only a few inches in height. Indigofera exigua is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
